bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, November 15, 1875

div1.p: Reed relates to Emilie Lawrence details of his brother's visit.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, November 15, 1875

opener.dateline:
Willet's Point.
N.Y. Harbor,
Monday Night-
Novr 15th 75.

div1.p:
Accept
these few hastily penned
words as an apology for
a letter- My Brother only arrived
on Sunday Night, & as he must
leave the City tomorrow morning
(Wednesday) & in the meantime
desires to see as many of
the sights and attractions
as possible, I must devote
my whole time to him. YesterdayToday
was entirely taken up with
various trips over the City,
so that we did not arrive
at home till quite late, To-
morrow, we leave the Post, at
8 a.m., for the city & I shall
not return till Wednesday
morning.

You will thus perceive,
my darling, that I have a very
good excuse for this short note,
and if you will only forgive
me this time, I'll write you a
long letter on Thursday.
div1.closer:
Goodbye, my darling,
your fond & devoted, Walter-
